Articles.Content:
9 hours ago, Viisuri said:

Getting this problem as well, at least 10 separate generations and yet I get the same result. I was using this around 2 weeks ago and it was fine until now.

Nevermind, found out Kcalbeloh is what's causing it. Any way to make them compatible?
@Viisuri Are you using Kcalbeloh's home switch options? The first thing to assume is that Sun is being replaced and Kopernicus is disagreeing with the order of things between the mods.
@JadeOfMaar No, however I am using rescale mods, guessing it's that. Not a big problem anyways, not like I require Kcalbeloh.

On 4/15/2024 at 12:49 PM, Viisuri said:

@JadeOfMaar No, however I am using rescale mods, guessing it's that. Not a big problem anyways, not like I require Kcalbeloh.

Are you still having this issue? I'm sorry for not responding earlier. I was just busy.

 

If so then what did you install in that 2 week span? I'm aware that the latest version has issues with parallax so you could check that out. Also could I get the Kopernicus logs? ( Kerbal Space Program/Logs/Logs-Kopernicus.zip ) to see if some planet is maybe missing its textures. (That issue you described is what happens when a planet is missing a heightmap for any reason.)

I had an issue where I would eventually get an infinite load screen when going to launchpad. It persisted across all saves and only a complete reinstall of the game would fix it. I narrowed it down to this mod by only installing it and its dependencies. Everything worked flawlessly until it happened and the galaxy I made looked phenomenal. 
 

I should note it wasn’t immediate but only when I had actually researched something capable of reaching interstellar locations. Creating a sandbox save wouldn’t let me do it all. I believe it was either the tracking station upgrades or researching more capable vessels. Either way I had to uninstall to be able to play and I’m hoping you can come across a fix as it looks so good

On 5/13/2024 at 8:15 PM, SpaceMonkeez said:

I had an issue where I would eventually get an infinite load screen when going to launchpad. It persisted across all saves and only a complete reinstall of the game would fix it. It's an issue with the stock maneuver tool. The instructions mention installing KSP Community Fixes and disabling the maneuver tool in the settings (those you'd find in the space center view, idk why they're different from the main menu settings)
I currently own a mac, can this work on that or is it an EXE-only sort of thing?

On 5/28/2024 at 4:47 PM, The Minmus Derp said:

I currently own a mac, can this work on that or is it an EXE-only sort of thing?

you can either install python and run the source code yourself (though the source code on github is outdated) or get some other computer with windows and just transfer the planets it generated into your mac
Is this compatible with Whirligig World?

On 6/5/2024 at 11:11 AM, Iapetus7342 said:

Is this compatible with Whirligig World?

probably
I can't launch any vessels with this mode. Another game functions works normally. How can i solve this trouble?

On 6/14/2024 at 11:30 PM, Vlad228 said:

I can't launch any vessels with this mode. Another game functions works normally. How can i solve this trouble?

install KSP community fixes and turn off the maneuver tool in the space center settings (scroll down and you'll see an option to turn off "maneuver tool")
